intro: Gloeospermum andinum, commonly known as the Andean gloeospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its vibrant foliage.
